responsecode200.name: responsecode200
responsecode200.example: Standard response for successful HTTP requests. The actual response will depend on the request method used. In a GET request, the response will contain an entity corresponding to the requested resource. In a POST request the response will contain an entity describing or containing the result of the action.

responsecode301.name: responsecode301
responsecode301.example: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI.

responsecode404.name: responsecode404
responsecode404.example: The requested resource could not be found but may be available again in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

responsecode500.name: responsecode500
responsecode500.example: A generic error message, given when no more specific message is suitable.
